controller

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • controller.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Client
extends java.lang.Thread
    Client class for the game Connect Four.
    Version:
    v1.0
    Author:
    Jan-Jaap van Raffe and Wouter Bos

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

      PrintStream for writing messages to the Server.

      Peer thread for all incoming messages from the Server.

      Player for knowing if the client plays as a human player of a computer player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client()
        Creates a new Client. Also sets up all communication with the server and asks if the client wants to send invites to everyone in the lobby. If yes, sends them. If no, waits for a suitable invite for a game.

    • Method Detail

        Gets the socket of this Client.

      • outputSetup

        private void outputSetup()
        Sets up the output to the socket.

      • confirmConnection

        private void confirmConnection()
        Sends our name to the server for connection. Awaits a response. If the response is right, the view will print that the connection is successful. Otherwise catches IOException or / and prints an error.

      • sendInvites

        private void sendInvites()
        Sends invites to everyone who is connected. Of course this method won't invite this client, because it would be stupid to invite yourself...

      • peerSetup

        private void peerSetup()
        Sets up a peer for incoming messages.

      • acceptInvite

        void acceptInvite(java.lang.String invite)
        Accepts every invite which comes in through the Peer, if the invite is suitable and the Client isn't in game. Otherwise declines the invite.
        Parameters:
        invite - the incoming invite message

      • gameStart

        void gameStart(java.lang.String message)
        Handles the Game-Start message from the server. First determines if the Client wants to let a computer player play for him. Then makes a new board. After that, determines if the player is player 1 or player 2 and makes a player corresponding to the Client's earlier choice. Last but not least: the view shows a gameStart message and the ingame status is set true.
        Parameters:
        message - the game-start message received from the server

      • setLobby

        void setLobby(java.lang.String lobby)
        Handles receiving the lobby from the Server. Remembers it in a field, without showing it to the client.
        Parameters:
        lobby - the lobby from the server.

      • printError

        void printError(java.lang.String error)
        Prints an error from the Server on the Standard Output.
        Parameters:
        error - The error message from the Server.

      • sendInvite

        private void sendInvite(java.lang.String opp)
        Sends an invite to an opponent. Also sends the supporting width and height with the invite.
        Parameters:
        opp - the name of the opponent

      • sendMove

        void sendMove()
        Determines the move and sends it to the server.

      • setMove

        void setMove(java.lang.String move)
        Handles the MOVE command from the server. First does the move on the board, then shows the board.
        Parameters:
        move - the MOVE command

      • gameEnd

        void gameEnd(java.lang.String message)
        Handles the end of a game. Shows the type of ending and terminates the program.
        Parameters:
        message - The end-game message from the server

      • shutDown

        void shutDown()
        Handles shutdown. Shows a message and terminates the program.

      • requestLobby

        private void requestLobby()
        Asks the server for the lobby.

      • run

        public void run()
        Waits for the peer to end.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
